reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice place with helpful staff and comfortable beds. Well located near the trams and lake but away from the noise. Inexpensive cafe around the corner, pretty common area away from lobby to meet friends.
reviews.title: Friendly,small well located quiet place.
Absolutely wonderful accomodation
reviews.text: After much research I came up with 3 hotels that sounded good for our 3 night stay in Geneva. After corresponding with all 3 decided on Tiffany Hotel and i am so pleased we did. What a fabulous comfortable well situated hotel that offers really everything you could want. We first off we're offered a good deal and breakfast included. I think because we only confirmed a day before we were due and for a weekend n holiday time when many people desert the city. We parked our car right outside ( and this hotel was very easy to find). They helped unload us ( few bags coming from NZ for 5 months European travel) and were just so helpful and informative with what to do, where to eat and what was on that weekend. They also parked our car in a secure parking area. Yes a bit expensive but thats Switzerland. We had a fabulous room in the new section - room 510. We had everything including great nepresso machine that makes coffee or you can use for tea, air con, wifi, cable TV and the area was so quiet. The breakfast was just amazing. Beautiful fresh food hot and cold. One of the best we have had in the last 3 months. really you won't do better than this hotel. I sited the old section and it looked great to with balcony and view

reviews.title: Nice hotel and good location
reviews.text: The four star hotel was located in a nice area very near good transportation. The staff was extremely helpful even attempting to change our airline reservations when we discovered that our last day we were spending in Geneva was a national holiday and the attractions we wished to see would be closed.We decided to spend our last day in France and they made wonderful suggestions as to where we should go(Annecy).We were told that our room was an upgrade because we were celebrating our anniversary.Although the room was adequate it was the smallest one we had during our two week trip across Switzerland.My other negative comment is about the price of a full breakfast which was not included in the room rate. It was 29 cf which did not include omlettes to be made fresh or even fried eggs made to order which were an additional 8cf. Fresh squeezed juice was also an additional 8cf.Continental breakfast of juice,one cup of coffee, and one croissant or sliced bread was 9cf.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However,because it was our anniversary, they sent to our room a beautiful selection of delicious fresh fruit.
reviews.title: An expensive stay but worth it.
Cosy hotel, a bit mazy
reviews.text: This hotel was worth the cost . It was well positioned for getting about Geneva. The hotel was friendly and informative on our arrival. Our room was what we had asked for ; no smoking, front facing, no pets. Eating out in Geneva is very expensive and after walking round Geneva, we realised what good value and quality the restaurant was. Expect to pay nearly double what you would in UK for a decent meal with a bottle of wine. Make sure that you use the city card , given to you at the hotel, for buses, trams and yellow boats, as you pay for it in your city tax, at 8 CHF a day. Which makes all public transport around the city area free, no need to pay for taxis and don't bring a car.

We stayed 4 days in two of the newly refurbished room of the Tiffany. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is very well situated, a short walk to the old town and nearby the theater hall the concert hall and the conservatory of Geneva. Very different neighborhood from the one where many of Geneva hotels are situated (train station). The hotel is very nice. Rooms, lobby, library, breakfast room, fitness room are all designed in a very good taste. Rooms are bit on the small size. We did have a problem with the air conditioning in the room. It was one of those hot days in Geneva and I was bit concern, remembering reading one of the past review in this matter in Tripadvisor but our experience was very different. Matter was taken very seriously. Problem was solved within very reasonable time and from that moment the air conditioning in the room was one of the best I've experienced in European hotels. Overall we enjoyed out stay very much and we hope to be back.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: This was our first European hotel stay and I was shocked at the size of the room! Very small and the elevators (lifts) even smaller! Words of wisom, have someone upstairs and someone downstairs and only put baggage in elevator! Staff were great people, they spoke English and were very courteous! We arrived around 9AM after an overnight flight and they let us check in. The coffee shop outside next door is great....but shocked by the $6 WATER! The hotel had a nice siting area in the lobby and another a little further back if you were waiting on people. The location was very convenient to all the shops, the Eau du jet, the historical sites, etc. There is a Cuban restaurant down the street from the hotel that was very good.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were met by a lovely lady at reception who came out the front door to help us, very friendly and helpful and she also upgraded us. The hotel was beautiful, very clean and well maintained and in a lovely position to everything. Thankyou so much to the Tiffany...
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay at Tiffany Hotel for 3 nights was fabulous. Our room/bathroom was extremely clean I mean you could eat off of the bathroom floor. The staff was beyond helpful with everything we asked of them. The only thing I would complain about is the breakfast buffet... I was not informed it cost 28 euros before I started eating.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 30 hours of flying and desperate for that long bath specially organized. Rang from Heathrow and lovely staff organized room to be ready early. Fantastic! But despit website, not all deluxe rooms have baths.... Great room, sound and light shutter a brilliant addition although we found it by mistake, great bed, breakfast great but expensive. Great area. Will be back but this time emphasize how important the bath is.
reviews.title: Great but....
Two Hotels in One
reviews.text: We stayed in room 114, which featured a queen bed and not two twins pushed together as in most of Europe. The bathroom is huge with a rain shower. Everything quite modern. From the lobby you expect and older style hotel, but I am guessing the lobby is a landmark and can't be updated. But once you walk past it you time travel to the 21st century. Wifi is free and Ethernet is in the room. Also Nescafé machine.

The location is great, and the service quite good. However, I was surprised to find there wasn't a mirror in the room at all. In addition, there was not even a bottle of free water (only in the paid for mini bar). The phone, the coffee machine and the weighing machine did not work either. I will certainly look for other alternatives the next time!
reviews.title: Good location, but poor quality of room facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Geneva is expensive. Keeping that in mind, Tiffany Hotel is probably a good place to stay. It's located on a quiet street not far from main attractions, the rooms are very small, but clean and comfortable, there is some thought put in the design of hotel's public areas, they have a valet parking and overall it is a decent little hotel.
reviews.title: Not bad..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One major turndown for me was that the floorboards are really thin and squeaky and I was kept up all night by a person walking around the room above.
reviews.title: Best find in Geneva

reviews.text: Overall, if you can afford to spend a little extra, stay elsewhere, if not, this is probably as good as it gets for Geneva rates.
reviews.title: Cozy but well equipped, central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room. The room had a double bed and a small bathroom with shower/bath combo, small sink (very little counter space) and a toilet. The hotel has an art nouveau, whimsical decor so it can be perceived as dated looking. The rooms were clean but small. Our room was just outside the small (max. 3 person) old elevator that makes a lot of noise when the door shuts/opens so we could hear it slamming and creaking from inside our room. Air conditioning was sufficient but not really cold. This could be because it was 35C (95 F) outside.
reviews.title: A bit disappointed

reviews.text: Staff was generally friendly although were not very knowledgable. We checked in around 3 pm and we were assigned to our room. When we went to the room, there was a cleaning lady that was still servicing the room so we had to wait a few minutes until they completed the cleaning. The front desk staff also misinformed us on parking prices at a nearby parking lot. We were informed that the parking would be about 30 swiss francs/night however it was 60! After the first night we drove around to find cheaper parking which was also available nearby. They also did not inform us about free street parking on Sunday which would have been useful to know. In addition, when we asked about cafe options nearby for breakfast, they suggested one that was actually closed, presumably for summer holidays.
reviews.title: Good place
Could be a great hotel....
reviews.text: One of the mornings, we were intruded on by staff that was delivering room service however we did not order room service. We were in bed sleeping since it was early in the morning and the staff entered our room. Our room was very small with no hallway leading to the bed so once you open the door, the staff would have full view of us in the bed. This intrustion disrupted our sleep and I was not impressed by this intrusion of privacy.

Also, one of the days our room had been cleaned however staff had only left 1 bath towel and 1 face cloth. This seemed a bit unusual since we had been previously receiving 2 new bath towels, 2 hand towels and 2 face cloths. Small detail but annoying and I would not expect this sort of thing to happen at a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel in middle of city

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was excellent. It was walking distance to old town, Jet d'eau, shopping including the famous Rue du Rhone, and many restaurants. Located on a quiet street so there was very little traffic noise.
reviews.title: overhyped
